Reviews.Title: Not very clear at night, not practical, not worth the $$$, look somewhere else for better Cameras
Reviews.Author: Saboken
Reviews.Content: The camera is great but seems to be out of focus at night I have tried to set the focus at night but it just won't my other cameras with preset focus look better at night, the night range is as listed but you can't make out faces! Also I had to call Q-See to get the cable and power adapter I was told by Q-See that all there cameras sell with these items! The seller said I was wrong? I have 8 other Q-See cameras that all came with the 60' cable and P/S and Q-See confirmed they all sell with such so if you buy one you might have to call Q-See the get the missing parts! And only authorized persons are allowed to sell the products on a site like amazon! Per there rules listed on there site. My camera was shipped direct from Q-SeeUpdate it has started to fail the color is way off I will not buy anything from Q-See again I have 8 off their smaller cheaper bullet cameras that are 3-4 years old and they still work like new this unit and another like it were a waste of $$$$$$ my $30.00 webcam gets a better picture than these over priced Cameras you are better off with their low end cameras you will get more for your money!!!!! also these cameras need to be readjusted after a power outage they have no memory retention at all even for a few seconds and getting to the little joystick on the cable near the camera is not practical once installed! also buying a UPS battery back up for each of them is also not practical.

Reviews.Title: Disappoint!
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, on paper everything looked good; long day/night range, new EFFIO-E chipset 700TVL. I thought this day/night bullet cam would nicely complement the rest of my diverse CCTV system.The reality is far different, this turned out to be one of the worst cameras I've ever tested.

Reviews.Title: False advertise.
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: Q-see 650TVL resolution 130ft night vision and 70ft of facial recognition color camera.I was surprised that this feature rich camera at this price. I just got this out of the box and connected it. I was so disappointed after I connected it. It advertised 650TVL high resolution but less than 100TVL poor quality video image. It advertised 130ft night vision but less than 30ft night vision when light fall. It advertised facial recognition, it never come true. You can only see mess. Cheap and low quality. False advertise. Not recommend

Reviews.Title: horible night vision
Reviews.Author: mbtech
Reviews.Content: purchased this camera after reading specs.i installed this camera and was pleased with it until it got dark.the night vision was black and blurry.all lights were lit.i have 8 other q-see cameras and i am pleased with them .this is the worst camera i have ever seen.do not buy.

ProductInfo.Features:
Power Consumption : 1.5 to 3.5 Watts (DC12V / >500mA)
Dimensions (L x W x H) : 8.25 x 3.5 x 4.25 in
Weight : 1.9 lbs (862 g)
For more Information Contact Our Sales Team At (650) 993-CCTV
Exposure : Auto/Fixed
Sync System : Internal
Video Output : 1.0Vp to p75Ω, BNC connection
Weatherproof : IP65
IR Wavelength : 850nm
Gamma Corrections : 0.45
Gain Control : Auto/Manual, 8 Levels
BLC: Yes
White Balance : ATW/PUSH/PUSH-LOCK/MANUAL/INDOOR/OUTDOOR
S/N Ratio : ≥52dB
Electronic Shutter : 1/50(1/60) to 1/100,000 Sec
Minimum Illumination : Ultra low light performance, 0.01 Lux when IR LED is on
IR Distance : 120ft
IR Lamps : 48 pcs
Focus : Manual
Field of View : 2.8mm = 81 degrees; 12mm = 22 degrees
Optical Format  : 1/3"
Image Sensor : Hi-Resolution Sony EXView HAD CCD, Effio-E
Total number of pixels : NTSC/PAL: 1020(H) x 508(V)
Effective Pixel Array : NTSC/PAL: 976(H) x 494(V)
Horizontal Resolution : High Image Quality. 650TV Lines
Internal Lens : 2.8 to 12mm Varifocal
